intro: Kielmeyera aureovinosa, commonly known as golden flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
